Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of development, structure and function of the principal organs and tissue of vascular plants.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text:
Complete all of the following
Complete the following: 
BOT3015 - Principles of Plant Science (3)
or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of plant kingdom utilizing comparative morphology and life cycle patterns. Highlights biotechnology, biological controls and utilization of plants in horticulture

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PCB 3522 or a "C" (2.0) or better in PCB 3023, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The medicinal properties of plants and their role in both traditional and modern medicine; history of herbal medicine and alternative medicinal practices around the world.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Biology Major, Plant Science Track, Senior standing, and BOT 3015 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: To acquire integrative experiences from internships, interviews, research experiences, ePortfolios to help build career readiness or apply for higher studies.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A grade of "C" (2.0) or better in both BSC 2011C and BOT 3015, a grade of "C" (2.0) or better in PCB 3063, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Course core concepts in plant genomics, including the structuring of plant genomes and the major ways in which they differ from animal and microbe genomes.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A "C" (2.0) or better in both BSC 2010C and BSC 2011C, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Historical and modern uses of plants economically important in various cultures.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to botanical concepts; plant biodiversity, structure and function, growth and development, photosynthesis and water relations and ecology.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This course is a survey of the Kingdom Fungi, covering the major topics of fungal diversity, structure, genetics, physiology, practical applications and pathogenicity.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BSC 2011C with "C" (2.0) or better; and PCB 3063 or MCB 3020C with "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Major topics of fungal biology, diversity, ecology, genetics, and genomics.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A grade of "C" (2.0) or better in BOT 3015 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Core concepts in plant physiology, with specific focus on photosynthesis, respiration, water relations, mineral nutrition, growth and allocation, hormones, secondary metabolites, reproduction, and stress physiology.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to techniques used in the preparation of microscope slides/specimens of vascular plants, including infecting organisms.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Systematic classification and identification of vascular plants, with emphasis on the flora of peninsular Florida.

BOT3018C - Culinary Botany Across the Cu.name: BOT3018C - Culinary Botany Across the Cultures

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Cultural food traditions and the connections between plants, people and health; examines the preparation methods that enhance the nutritional values.
